meanings.definition: A barren area of land with little or no vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The camel traveled through the hot desert.
meanings.sent2: The desert is a dry and sandy place.
meanings.sent3: I wouldn't want to get lost in a desert without water!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a desert, empty and desolate.
meanings.sent5: The desert stretched out endlessly under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: To abandon or leave someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He decided to desert his old car and buy a new one.
meanings.sent2: Please don't desert me in this unfamiliar place.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich was so delicious, I couldn't desert it halfway.
meanings.sent4: The soldier felt guilty when he had to desert his injured comrade.
meanings.sent5: I promised not to desert you, no matter what happens.

meanings.definition: Deserve or be worthy of something.
meanings.sent1: After all his hard work, he truly does desert the promotion.
meanings.sent2: She doesn't desert the praise for her beautiful artwork.
meanings.sent3: Even though the cake was tempting, I knew I didn't desert the calories.
meanings.sent4: The dedicated team truly does desert the championship trophy.
meanings.sent5: Her kindness and generosity truly do desert recognition and gratitude.
